sec.p: Low polymorphism has been recorded at Clock in seven breeding barn swallow populations ( Dor et al., 2011; Caprioli et al., 2012; N Saino, M Caprioli & AP Møller, unpublished data). Yet, in an Italian population where the association between Clock and breeding phenology has been investigated, females with a rare ( Q 7/ Q 8) genotype have been observed to delay breeding, with negative consequence on seasonal reproductive success. In addition, frequency of Q 7/ Q 8 is higher among yearlings than among two or more years old individuals, suggesting that Clock affects breeding phenology in this species and selection occurs against a rare, phenologically deviant genotype ( Caprioli et al., 2012).
